title: overview
text: Frequently work tables use stock id fishery id identify stocks fisheries; useful programming, id numbers easiest read. label_stocks() label_fisheries() use stock_id fishery_id add human-readable stock fishery names. functions flexible (can manually specify species ), simplest use-case label tables pulled fram database framrosetta package, works default arguments. example, using artificial dataframe use framrsquared::fetch_table() vignettes.
code: ## create example data with random coho stock id, fishery ids, and landed catch ## We use  dat = stock_coho_fram[sample(1:nrow(stock_coho_fram), size = 5),] |>    dplyr::select(stock_id) |>    mutate(fishery_id = sample(1:200, size = length(stock_id), replace = TRUE),            landed_catch = runif(length(stock_id), min = 1, max = 1000)) # This makes a dataframe that could reasonably be output from framrsquared functions dat #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   stock_id fishery_id landed_catch #>      <dbl>      <int>        <dbl> #> 1      173        102        875.  #> 2      151        111        176.  #> 3      204         47         35.2 #> 4       63        159        321.  #> 5      229        196        403. ## Not very human readable ## make the stock_id human readable dat |>    label_stocks() #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   stock_id stock_label                          fishery_id landed_catch #>      <dbl> <chr>                                     <int>        <dbl> #> 1      173 Wash Late Wild UnMarked                     102        875.  #> 2      151 Chehalis River Hatchery UnMarked            111        176.  #> 3      204 California Central Coast Wild Marked         47         35.2 #> 4       63 Deschutes River (WA) Wild UnMarked          159        321.  #> 5      229 Upper Fraser River Hatchery UnMarked        196        403.  ## make both stock_id and fishery_id human readable dat |>    label_stocks() |>    label_fisheries() #> # A tibble: 5 × 5 #>   stock_id stock_label                     fishery_id fishery_label landed_catch #>      <dbl> <chr>                                <int> <chr>                <dbl> #> 1      173 Wash Late Wild UnMarked                102 WA Area 8 Tr…        875.  #> 2      151 Chehalis River Hatchery UnMark…        111 WA Area 8D N…        176.  #> 3      204 California Central Coast Wild …         47 Willapa Bay …         35.2 #> 4       63 Deschutes River (WA) Wild UnMa…        159 Area 12C-12D…        321.  #> 5      229 Upper Fraser River Hatchery Un…        196 SEAK Northwe…        403.

title: overview
text: identify stock fishery ID number, find stock fishery ID based name, framrosetta includes two search functions. fishery_search takes either fishery ID number full partial name returns tibble summarizing fisheries match; stock_search stocks. cases, species argument must provided determine function return relevant "CHINOOK" "COHO" fisheries / stocks. pattern argument can take regular expressions, case insensitive.
code: ## Figure out the coho fishery ids for the kmz fisheries fishery_search("kmz", "COHO") #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   species version_number fishery_id fishery_name fishery_title #>   <chr>            <int>      <int> <chr>        <chr>         #> 1 COHO                 1          5 Ca KMZ Spt   KMZ Sport     #> 2 COHO                 1          6 Ca KMZ Trl   KMZ Troll ## Figure out which Coho fishery has id 50 fishery_search(50, "COHO") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   species version_number fishery_id fishery_name fishery_title            #>   <chr>            <int>      <int> <chr>        <chr>                    #> 1 COHO                 1         50 GryHbr Net   Grays Harbor Estuary Net ## Find all the Chinook noocksack stocks stock_search("nooksack", "CHINOOK") #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   species stock_version stock_id production_region_number management_unit_number #>   <chr>           <int>    <int>                    <int>                  <int> #> 1 CHINOOK             5        4                        1                      6 #> 2 CHINOOK             5        6                        1                     10 #> 3 CHINOOK             5        2                        1                      2 #> 4 CHINOOK             5        3                        1                      5 #> 5 CHINOOK             5        5                        1                      9 #> 6 CHINOOK             5        1                        1                      1 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: stock_name <chr>, stock_long_name <chr> ## Figure out which Chinook stock has id 21 stock_search(21, "CHINOOK") #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   species stock_version stock_id production_region_number management_unit_number #>   <chr>           <int>    <int>                    <int>                  <int> #> 1 CHINOOK             5       21                        4                      1 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: stock_name <chr>, stock_long_name <chr>

title: overview
text: Chinook , backwards FRAM algorithm uses separate stock ID system hard-coded FRAM. underlying idea normally FRAM tracks two versions stock (marked unmarked), occasionally four versions stock (marked unmarked). part backwards fram Chinook, algorithm separately handles total number fish across versions stock allocation fish two (four) stocks. , algorithm creates new stock id numbering system, additional “sum” stock pairs (sets four) marked/unmarked marked/unmarked x hatch/natural stocks. Unfortunately, means BackwardFRAM table Chinook database StockID match StockID column tables. framrosetta::bk_lookup_chin maps stock ids BackwardsFRAM table ($bk_stock_id) stock ids everywhere else ($stock_id).

text: can install framrosetta R-Universe like : Otherwise, Rtools either devtools pak installed, can install framrosetta source code like :

what: Lookup table for Chinook stock IDs from BkFRAM to normal FRAM — bk_lookup_chin
title: Lookup table for Chinook stock IDs from BkFRAM to normal FRAM — bk_lookup_chin
text: table based Chinook stock tables pre-season 2024. Additional stock may added future (splitting stock aggregates). `bk_lookupfun_chin()` function accommodates .

title: Lookup table for Chinook stock IDs from BkFRAM to normal FRAM — bk_lookup_chin
Lookup table for Chinook stock IDs from BkFRAM to normal FRAM — bk_lookup_chin
text: data frame 116 rows 3 columns: stock_name_bk Stock name bk_stock_id Stock ID BackwardsFRAM table stock_id Stock ID anywhere else FRAM TAMM

title: Lookup table for Chinook stock IDs from BkFRAM to normal FRAM — bk_lookup_chin
text: 2024 Pre-Season Chinook DB.mdb

what: Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
title: Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
text: present FRAM databases use differents stock_id numbering system BackwardsFRAM  table everywhere else. dataframe `bk_lookup_chin` provides lookup table based stocks  used Preseason 2024. However, working modify FRAM support splitting Chinook stock aggregates,  lead increased numbers StockIDs. `bk_lookupfun_chin` provides appropruate lookup table based `max_stock` argument, either  returning `bk_lookup_chin` (max_stock provided exceed stocks `bk_lookup_chin`) extending dataframe  new stock ids based numbering conventions bk_stock_id.

title: Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
text: max_stock Positive integer representing largest *Normal* stock id (stock ids outside BackwardsFram table). Preseason 2024, 78 stocks; splitting stocks might increase (e.g. 80, 82, 84). Defaults NA.

title: Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
text: Tibble lookup table. `$stock_name_bk` gives numan-readable stock names; `$bk_stock_id` gives "StockID" used backwards FRAM; `$stock_id` gives StockID used everywhere else. NAs `$stock_id` correspond "totalled" stocks, used backwards FRAM nowhere else.

title: Generate Chinook bk_fram look-up table — bk_lookupfun_chin
code: temp = bk_lookupfun_chin(80) tail(temp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   stock_name_bk                     bk_stock_id stock_id #>   <chr>                                   <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 OR Mid Coast Fall                         114       NA #> 2 -----  UnMarked OR Mid Coast Fall         115       77 #> 3 -----  Marked OR Mid Coast Fall           116       78 #> 4 New _total_ stock (bkFRAM-only)           117       NA #> 5 New stock (presumed UnMarked)             118       79 #> 6 New stock (presumed Marked)               119       80

what: Search through fishery and stock lookup tables. — fishery_search
title: Search through fishery and stock lookup tables. — fishery_search
text: Search fishery stock lookup tables.

title: Search through fishery and stock lookup tables. — fishery_search
Search through fishery and stock lookup tables. — fishery_search
text: pattern Character string pattern search , case insensitive. numeric instead, function return row corresponding stock fishery ID. species "CHINOOK" "COHO" (lowercase permutations)

title: Search through fishery and stock lookup tables. — fishery_search
code: fishery_search("kmz", "COHO") #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   species version_number fishery_id fishery_name fishery_title #>   <chr>            <int>      <int> <chr>        <chr>         #> 1 COHO                 1          5 Ca KMZ Spt   KMZ Sport     #> 2 COHO                 1          6 Ca KMZ Trl   KMZ Troll     fishery_search(50, "COHO") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   species version_number fishery_id fishery_name fishery_title            #>   <chr>            <int>      <int> <chr>        <chr>                    #> 1 COHO                 1         50 GryHbr Net   Grays Harbor Estuary Net stock_search("nooksack", "CHINOOK") #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   species stock_version stock_id production_region_number management_unit_number #>   <chr>           <int>    <int>                    <int>                  <int> #> 1 CHINOOK             5        4                        1                      6 #> 2 CHINOOK             5        6                        1                     10 #> 3 CHINOOK             5        2                        1                      2 #> 4 CHINOOK             5        3                        1                      5 #> 5 CHINOOK             5        5                        1                      9 #> 6 CHINOOK             5        1                        1                      1 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: stock_name <chr>, stock_long_name <chr> stock_search(21, "CHINOOK") #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   species stock_version stock_id production_region_number management_unit_number #>   <chr>           <int>    <int>                    <int>                  <int> #> 1 CHINOOK             5       21                        4                      1 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: stock_name <chr>, stock_long_name <chr>

what: Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
title: Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
text: Streamlined version using `left_join`, `rename`, `relocate` add human-readable text dataframe fishery_id similar columns. Automatically detects species `fishery_id` column; user can specify species alternative name fishery_id column needed.

title: Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
text: .data Dataframe containing `fishery_id` column (analogous column different name specied `fisheries_col` argument) species character atomic identifying either "CHINOOK" "COHO" (variations ). Defaults `NULL`; needed `.data` species defined attribute. Tables read fram database using `framrsquared` package automatically appropriate species attribute. fisheries_col character atomic identifying column treated containing fishery_id values Defaults `fishery_id`.

title: Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
text: Data frame additional column `fishery_label`

title: Add `fishery_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_fisheries
code: ## create example data dat = data.frame(fishery_id = sample(1:73, size = 10, replace = TRUE)) ## Add fishery label dat |> label_fisheries(species = "CHINOOK") #>    fishery_id     fishery_label #> 1          45 NT Area 8-1 Sport #> 2          23 NrT G. Harbor Net #> 3          63   Tr Area 10E Net #> 4          47     Tr Skagit Net #> 5          31  Central OR Sport #> 6          68        NT SPS Net #> 7          73    Freshwater Net #> 8          69        Tr SPS Net #> 9           5       BC WCVI Net #> 10         24   T G. Harbor Net

what: Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
title: Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
text: Streamlined version using `left_join`, `rename`, `relocate` add human-readable text dataframe stock_id similar columns. Automatically detects species `stock_id` column; user can specify species alternative name stock_d column needed.

title: Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
text: .data Dataframe containing `stock_id` column (analogous column different name specied `stocks_col` argument) species character atomic identifying either "CHINOOK" "COHO" (variations ). Defaults `NULL`; needed `.data` species defined attribute. Tables read fram database using `framrsquared` package automatically appropriate species attribute. stocks_col character atomic identifying column treated containing stock_id values Defaults `stock_id`.

title: Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
text: Data frame additional column `stock_label`

title: Add `stock_label` column to describe fisheries of dataframe — label_stocks
code: ## create example data dat = data.frame(stock_id = sample(1:73, size = 10, replace = TRUE)) ## Add stock information dat |> label_stocks(species = "CHINOOK") #>    stock_id                          stock_label #> 1         2          Marked Nooksack/Samish Fall #> 2        62            Marked Fraser River Early #> 3        55     UnMarked Oregon North Coast Fall #> 4        43 UnMarked CR Bonneville Pool Hatchery #> 5        62            Marked Fraser River Early #> 6        43 UnMarked CR Bonneville Pool Hatchery #> 7         5       UnMarked Nooksack Spr Hatchery #> 8        44   Marked CR Bonneville Pool Hatchery #> 9        61          UnMarked Fraser River Early #> 10       34          Marked Hood Canal Fall Year

title: Coho limiting stock — limiting_stock_coho
text: Maps limiting stock Coho TAMM (e.g., 'Hood Canal Wild') FRAM stock ids. Useful summarizing impacts stocks concern.

title: Coho limiting stock — limiting_stock_coho
text: tibble 10 rows 2 columns: name Name limiting stock name_tamm Exact match limiting stock name TAMM stock_id_vec list numeric vectors, containing fram stock_id values TAMM limiting stock #' @source 2024 Pre-Season Chinook DB.mdb

text: data frame 4 rows 5 columns: species Species name version_number  time_step_id id number time step time_step_name Span timestep. Timesteps start first month, end last month.
